ai-dn33:1.1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Mallas together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants when he arrived at a Mallian town named Pāvā.
ai-dn33:1.1.3_0: where he stayed in Cunda the smith’s mango grove.
ai-dn33:1.2.1_0: Now at that time a new town hall named Ubbhaṭaka had recently been constructed for the Mallas of Pāvā. It had not yet been occupied by an ascetic or brahmin or any person at all.
ai-dn33:1.2.2_0: The Mallas of Pāvā also heard
ai-dn33:1.2.2_1: “The Buddha was wandering in the land of the Mallas together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants.”
ai-dn33:1.2.3_0: Then the Mallas of Pāvā went to the Fortunate One,
ai-dn33:1.2.3_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-dn33:1.2.3_2: While sat on one side, the Mallas of Pāvā said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-dn33:1.2.4_0: “Sir, a new town hall named Ubbhaṭaka has recently been constructed for the Mallas of Pāvā. It has not yet been occupied by an ascetic or brahmin or any person at all.
ai-dn33:1.2.5_0: May the Buddha be the first to use it, and only then will the Mallas of Pāvā use it.
ai-dn33:1.2.6_0: That would be for the lasting welfare and happiness of the Mallas of Pāvā.”
ai-dn33:1.2.7_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-dn33:1.3.1_0: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, the Mallas got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right.
ai-dn33:1.3.1_1: and after going, spread out a seat and spread out the waterpot, they prepared a seat and placed it on the ground. Then they went to the Buddha,
ai-dn33:1.3.3_0: and told him of their preparations, saying,
ai-dn33:1.3.4_0: “Sir, when the Buddha has laid down the seats spread out, the water would set up a lamp in a water jar.
ai-dn33:1.3.5_0: adding, “Sir, please come at your convenience.”
ai-dn33:1.4.1_0: Then the Buddha robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the new town hall together with the Saṅgha of mendicants.
ai-dn33:1.4.1_1: and after approaching, washing his feet, and entering the town hall, he sat down facing the east,
ai-dn33:1.4.2_0: The Saṅgha of mendicants also washed their feet, entered the town hall, and sat against the west wall facing east, with the Buddha right in front of them.
ai-dn33:1.4.3_0: The Mallas of Pāvā also washed their feet, entered the town hall, and sat against the east wall facing west, with the Buddha right in front of them.
ai-dn33:1.4.4_0: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the Mallas with a Dhamma talk. Then he dismissed them,
ai-dn33:1.4.7_0: “Yes, sir,” replied the Mallas. They got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right, before leaving.
ai-dn33:1.5.1_0: Soon after they left, the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-dn33:1.5.2_0: “Sāriputta, the Saṅgha of mendicants is rid of dullness and drowsiness.
ai-dn33:1.5.3_0: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.
ai-dn33:1.5.7_0: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.
ai-dn33:1.6.1_0: At that time Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta had adorned with dirty winds.
ai-dn33:1.6.2_0: With his passing the Jain ascetics split, dividing into two factions, arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words:
ai-dn33:1.6.3_0: “You don’t understand this teaching and training. I understand this teaching and training. What, you understand this teaching and training?
ai-dn33:1.6.3_1: I understand this teaching and training.
ai-dn33:1.6.3_3: I stay on topic, you don’t.
ai-dn33:1.6.3_4: You said last what you should have said first. You said first what you should have said last. What you’ve thought so much about has been disproved. Your doctrine is refuted. Go on, save your doctrine! You’re trapped; get yourself out of this—if you can!”
ai-dn33:1.6.4_0: You’d think there was nothing but slaughter going on among the Jain ascetics.
ai-dn33:1.6.5_0: And the Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta’s white-clothed lay disciples were disillusioned, dismayed, and disappointed in the Jain ascetics. They were equally disappointed with a teaching and training so poorly explained and poorly propounded, not emancipating, not leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is not a fully awakened Buddha, with broken monument and without a refuge.
ai-dn33:1.7.1_0: Then Sāriputta told the mendicants about these things. He went on to say,

ai-dn33:1.7.5_0: But this teaching is well explained and well propounded to us by the Blessed One, emancipating, leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is a fully awakened Buddha.

ai-dn33:1.11.82_0: If the faculty of mind were left unrestrained, bad unskillful qualities of desire and aversion would become overwhelming. For this reason, they practice restraint, protecting the faculty of mind, and achieving its restraint.
ai-dn33:1.11.83_0: This is called the effort to restrain.
ai-dn33:1.11.84_0: And what is the effort to give up?
ai-dn33:1.11.85_0: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t tolerate a sensual,
ai-dn33:1.11.87_0: or cruel thought that’s arisen, but gives it up, gets rid of it, eliminates it, and obliterates it.
ai-dn33:1.11.88_0: They don’t tolerate any bad, unskillful qualities that have arisen, but give them up, get rid of them, eliminate them, and obliterate them.
ai-dn33:1.11.89_0: This is called the effort to give up.
ai-dn33:1.11.90_0: And what is the effort to develop?
ai-dn33:1.11.91_0: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness,
ai-dn33:1.11.97_0: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.
ai-dn33:1.11.98_0: This is called the effort to develop.
ai-dn33:1.11.99_0: And what is the effort to preserve?
ai-dn33:1.11.100_0: It’s when a mendicant preserves a meditation subject that’s a fine foundation of immersion: the perception of a skeleton, a worm-infested corpse, a livid corpse, a split open corpse, or a bloated corpse.
ai-dn33:1.11.101_0: This is called the effort to preserve.
ai-dn33:1.11.103_0: knowledge of the present phenomena, inferential knowledge, knowledge of others’ minds, and conventional knowledge.
ai-dn33:1.11.105_0: knowing about suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
ai-dn33:1.11.107_0: associating with good people, listening to the true teaching, proper attention, and practicing in line with the teaching.
ai-dn33:1.11.109_0: Here, venerable friends, a noble disciple is endowed with perfect confidence in the Buddha (thus):
ai-dn33:1.11.110_0: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
ai-dn33:1.11.111_0: is endowed with perfect confidence in the Dhamma,
ai-dn33:1.11.112_0: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’
ai-dn33:1.11.113_0: Here, venerable friends, a noble disciple is endowed with perfect confidence in the Community (thinking):
ai-dn33:1.11.114_0: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, direct, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’
ai-dn33:1.11.115_0: And a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
ai-dn33:1.11.116_0: Four fruits of the ascetic life:
ai-dn33:1.11.121_0: solid food, whether coarse or fine; contact is the second, mental intention the third, and consciousness the fourth.
ai-dn33:1.11.123_0: As long as consciousness remains, it remains involved with form, supported by form, founded on form. And with a sprinkle of relishing, it grows, increases, and matures.
ai-dn33:1.11.124_0: Or consciousness remains involved with feeling ...
ai-dn33:1.11.125_0: Or consciousness remains involved with perception ...
ai-dn33:1.11.126_0: Or consciousness remains involved with choices, supported by choices, grounded on choices. And with a sprinkle of relishing, it grows, increases, and matures.
ai-dn33:1.11.127_0: Four ways of making prejudiced decisions:
ai-dn33:1.11.128_0: making decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

ai-dn33:1.11.130_0: Craving arises in a mendicant for the sake of robes,
ai-dn33:1.11.132_0: Craving arises in a mendicant for the sake of furniture.

ai-dn33:1.11.135_0: painful practice with swift insight, and pleasant practice with swift insight.
ai-dn33:1.11.137_0: Impatient practice, patient practice, taming practice, and calming practice.
ai-dn33:1.11.139_0: contentment, good will, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-dn33:1.11.140_0: Four ways of taking up practices.
ai-dn33:1.11.141_0: There is a way of taking up practices that is painful now and results in future pain.
ai-dn33:1.11.142_0: There is a way of taking up practices that is painful now but results in future pleasure.
ai-dn33:1.11.143_0: There is a way of taking up practices that is pleasant now but results in future pain.
ai-dn33:1.11.144_0: There is a way of taking up practices that is pleasant now and results in future pleasure.
ai-dn33:1.11.150_0: the foundations of wisdom, truth, generosity, and peace.
ai-dn33:1.11.152_0: There is a question that should be answered definitively. There is a question that should be answered analytically. There is a question that should be answered with a counter-question. There is a question that should be set aside.

ai-dn33:1.11.155_0: There are deeds that are bright with bright result.
ai-dn33:1.11.156_0: There are dark and bright deeds with dark and bright result.
ai-dn33:1.11.157_0: There are neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the end of deeds.

ai-dn33:1.11.160_0: The passing away and rebirth of sentient beings is to be realized with vision.

ai-dn33:1.11.166_0: sensuality, desire for rebirth, views, and ignorance.

ai-dn33:1.11.174_0: reproduction for creatures born from an egg, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
ai-dn33:1.11.176_0: Someone is unaware when conceived in their mother’s womb, unaware as they remain there, and unaware as they emerge. This is the first kind of conception.
ai-dn33:1.11.177_0: Furthermore, someone is aware when conceived in their mother’s womb, but unaware as they remain there, and unaware as they emerge. This is the second kind of conception.
ai-dn33:1.11.178_0: Furthermore, someone is aware when conceived in their mother’s womb, aware as they remain there, and unaware as they emerge. This is the third kind of conception.
ai-dn33:1.11.179_0: Furthermore, someone is aware when conceived in their mother’s womb, aware as they remain there, and aware as they emerge. This is the fourth kind of conception.
ai-dn33:1.11.181_0: There is a reincarnation where only one’s own intention is effective, not that of others.
ai-dn33:1.11.182_0: There is a reincarnation where only the intention of others is effective, not one’s own.
ai-dn33:1.11.183_0: There is a reincarnation where both one’s own and others’ intentions are effective.
ai-dn33:1.11.184_0: There is a reincarnation where neither one’s own nor others’ intentions are effective.
ai-dn33:1.11.185_0: Four ways of purifying a religious donation.
ai-dn33:1.11.186_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by the giver, not the recipient.
ai-dn33:1.11.187_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by the recipient, not the giver.
ai-dn33:1.11.188_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by neither the giver nor the recipient.
ai-dn33:1.11.189_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by both the giver and the recipient.
ai-dn33:1.11.191_0: giving, kindly words, taking care, and equality.
ai-dn33:1.11.193_0: refraining from speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.
ai-dn33:1.11.195_0: refraining from speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical.
ai-dn33:1.11.197_0: Saying you’ve seen, heard, thought, or known something, but you haven’t.
ai-dn33:1.11.199_0: saying you haven’t seen, heard, thought, or known something, and you haven’t.
ai-dn33:1.11.201_0: saying you haven’t seen, heard, thought, or known something, and you have.
ai-dn33:1.11.203_0: saying you’ve seen, heard, thought, or known something, and you have.
ai-dn33:1.11.205_0: One person mortifies themselves, committed to the practice of mortifying themselves.
ai-dn33:1.11.206_0: One person mortifies others, committed to the practice of mortifying others.
ai-dn33:1.11.207_0: One person mortifies themselves and others, committed to the practice of mortifying themselves and others.
ai-dn33:1.11.208_0: One person neither mortifies themselves nor others, committed to the practice of not mortifying themselves or others.
ai-dn33:1.11.209_0: They live without wishes in the present life, extinguished, cooled, experiencing bliss, having become holy in themselves.
ai-dn33:1.11.211_0: One person practices to benefit themselves, but not others.
ai-dn33:1.11.212_0: One person practices to benefit others, but not themselves.
ai-dn33:1.11.213_0: One person practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.
ai-dn33:1.11.214_0: One person practices to benefit both themselves and others.
ai-dn33:1.11.216_0: the dark bound for darkness, the dark bound for light, the light bound for darkness, and the light bound for light.
ai-dn33:1.11.218_0: the confirmed ascetic, the white lotus ascetic, the pink lotus ascetic, and the exquisite ascetic of ascetics.
ai-dn33:1.11.219_0: These are the teachings grouped by four that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:1.11.220_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:1.11.221_0: The first recitation section is finished.
ai-dn33:2.1.1_0: There are teachings grouped by five that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:2.1.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.

ai-dn33:2.1.17_0: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material possessions, praise, and the teachings.

ai-dn33:2.1.23_0: Desire for rebirth in the realm of luminous form, desire for rebirth in the formless realm, conceit, restlessness, and ignorance.
ai-dn33:2.1.25_0: refraining from killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and drinking alcohol, which is a basis for negligence.
ai-dn33:2.1.26_0: Five things that can’t be done.
ai-dn33:2.1.27_0: A mendicant with defilements ended can’t deliberately take the life of a living creature,
ai-dn33:2.1.27_1: A mendicant who has ended defilements is incapable of stealing, who steals from others.
ai-dn33:2.1.27_2: A mendicant with defilements ended can’t have sexual intercourse.
ai-dn33:2.1.27_3: A mendicant who has ended defilements.
ai-dn33:2.1.27_4: A mendicant with defilements ended can’t deliberately used to eat the storms they had before.
ai-dn33:2.1.29_0: Loss of relatives, wealth, health, ethics, and view.
ai-dn33:2.1.30_0: It is not because of loss of relatives, wealth, or health that sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-dn33:2.1.31_0: It is because of loss of ethics or view that sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-dn33:2.1.33_0: endowment with relatives, wealth, health, ethics, and view.
ai-dn33:2.1.34_0: It is not because of endowment with family, wealth, or health that sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-dn33:2.1.35_0: It is because of endowment with ethics or view that sentient beings, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-dn33:2.1.36_0: Five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.
ai-dn33:2.1.37_0: Firstly, an unethical person loses substantial wealth on account of negligence.
ai-dn33:2.1.39_0: Furthermore, an unethical person gets a bad reputation.
ai-dn33:2.1.41_0: Whenever they come to a gathering of people—whether a gathering of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics—they are diffident and timid.
ai-dn33:2.1.43_0: Furthermore, an unethical person feels lost when they die.
ai-dn33:2.1.45_0: Furthermore, an unethical person, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
ai-dn33:2.1.47_0: Five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.
ai-dn33:2.1.48_0: Firstly, an ethical person gains substantial wealth on account of diligence.
ai-dn33:2.1.50_0: Furthermore, an ethical person gets a good reputation.
ai-dn33:2.1.52_0: Whenever they come to a gathering of people—whether a gathering of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics—they are confident and self-assured.
ai-dn33:2.1.54_0: Furthermore, an ethical person dies not feeling lost.
ai-dn33:2.1.56_0: Furthermore, when an ethical person’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
ai-dn33:2.1.58_0: A mendicant who wants to accuse another should first establish five things in themselves.
ai-dn33:2.1.59_0: ‘I’ll speak at an appropriate time, not at an inappropriate one;
ai-dn33:2.1.60_0: I’ll speak the truth, not falsehood;
ai-dn33:2.1.62_0: I’ll speak what’s beneficial, not what’s unbeneficial;
ai-dn33:2.1.63_0: I will speak lovingly, not from secret hate.
ai-dn33:2.1.64_0: A mendicant who wants to accuse another should first establish these five things in themselves.

ai-dn33:2.1.68_0: He is rarely ill or unwell. His stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.

ai-dn33:2.1.71_0: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.

ai-dn33:2.1.77_0: Firstly, a mendicant has doubts about the Teacher. They’re uncertain, undecided, and lacking confidence.
ai-dn33:2.1.78_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving. This is the first kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-dn33:2.1.79_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has doubts about the teaching ...
ai-dn33:2.1.82_0: A mendicant is angry and upset with their spiritual companions, resentful and closed off.
ai-dn33:2.1.83_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving. This is the fifth kind of emotional barrenness.
ai-dn33:2.1.85_0: Firstly, a mendicant isn’t free of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for sensual pleasures.
ai-dn33:2.1.86_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-dn33:2.1.87_0: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-dn33:2.1.88_0: This is the first emotional shackle.

ai-dn33:2.1.90_0: They’re not free of greed for form ...
ai-dn33:2.1.91_0: They eat as much as they like until their bellies are full, then indulge in the pleasures of sleeping, lying, and drowsing ...
ai-dn33:2.1.92_0: They lead the spiritual life hoping to be reborn in one of the orders of gods, thinking:
ai-dn33:2.1.92_1: ‘By this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I become one of the gods!’
ai-dn33:2.1.93_0: But those who lead the spiritual life wishing to be reborn in one of the orders of gods:
ai-dn33:2.1.93_1: ‘By this precept or observance or mortification or spiritual life, may I not incline towards the gods of emotion.’
ai-dn33:2.1.93_2: This being so, their mind doesn’t incline toward keenness, commitment, persistence, and striving.
ai-dn33:2.1.94_0: This is the fifth emotional shackle.
ai-dn33:2.1.96_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-dn33:2.1.98_0: pleasure, pain, happiness, sadness, and equanimity.
ai-dn33:2.1.100_0: faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-dn33:2.1.102_0: A mendicant focuses on sensual pleasures, but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about them.
ai-dn33:2.1.103_0: But when they focus on renunciation, their mind is eager ...
ai-dn33:2.1.104_0: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, well freed, and well detached from sensual pleasures.
ai-dn33:2.1.105_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of sensual pleasures, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-dn33:2.1.106_0: This is how the escape from sensual pleasures is explained.
ai-dn33:2.1.107_0: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on ill will, but their mind isn’t eager ...
ai-dn33:2.1.108_0: But when they focus on good will, their mind is eager ...
ai-dn33:2.1.109_0: Their mind is in a good state ... well detached from ill will.
ai-dn33:2.1.110_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of ill will, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-dn33:2.1.111_0: This is how the escape from ill will is explained.
ai-dn33:2.1.112_0: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on harming, but their mind isn’t eager ...

ai-dn33:2.1.114_0: Their mind is in a good state ... well detached from harming.
ai-dn33:2.1.115_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of harming, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-dn33:2.1.116_0: This is how the escape from thoughts is explained.
ai-dn33:2.1.117_0: Take another case where a mendicant focuses on form, but their mind isn’t eager ...
ai-dn33:2.1.118_0: But when they focus on the formless, their mind is eager ...
ai-dn33:2.1.119_0: Their mind is in a good state ... well detached from forms.
ai-dn33:2.1.120_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of form, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-dn33:2.1.121_0: This is how the escape from forms is explained.
ai-dn33:2.1.122_0: Take a case where a mendicant focuses on identity, but their mind isn’t eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.
ai-dn33:2.1.123_0: But when they focus on the ending of identity, their mind is eager, confident, settled, and decided about it.
ai-dn33:2.1.124_0: Their mind is in a good state, well developed, well risen, well freed, and well detached from identity.
ai-dn33:2.1.125_0: They’re freed from the distressing and feverish defilements that arise because of identity, so they don’t experience that kind of feeling.
ai-dn33:2.1.126_0: This is how the escape from identity is explained.
ai-dn33:2.1.128_0: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant.
ai-dn33:2.1.129_0: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.
ai-dn33:2.1.130_0: Feeling inspired, joy springs up. Being joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, one feels bliss. And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed.
ai-dn33:2.1.131_0: This is the first opportunity for freedom.
ai-dn33:2.1.132_0: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant. But the mendicant teaches Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it. ...
ai-dn33:2.1.133_0: Or the mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it. ...
ai-dn33:2.1.134_0: But the mendicant thinks about and considers the teaching in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it. ...
ai-dn33:2.1.135_0: But a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.
ai-dn33:2.1.136_0: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.
ai-dn33:2.1.137_0: Feeling inspired, joy springs up. Being joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, one feels bliss. And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed.
ai-dn33:2.1.138_0: This is the fifth opportunity for freedom.
ai-dn33:2.1.139_0: Five perceptions that ripen in freedom:
ai-dn33:2.1.140_0: the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in impermanence, the perception of not-self in suffering, the perception of giving up, and the perception of fading away.
ai-dn33:2.1.141_0: These are the teachings grouped by five that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:2.1.142_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:2.2.1_0: There are teachings grouped by six that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:2.2.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.

ai-dn33:2.2.27_0: When they smell an odor with their nose ...
ai-dn33:2.2.28_0: Tasting a flavor with the tongue ...
ai-dn33:2.2.29_0: Feeling a touch with the body ...

ai-dn33:2.2.32_0: Seeing a sight with the eye, one is preoccupied with a sight that’s a basis for sadness. ...
ai-dn33:2.2.33_0: Knowing a thought with the mind, one is preoccupied with a thought that’s a basis for sadness.
ai-dn33:2.2.35_0: Seeing a sight with the eye, one is preoccupied with a sight that’s a basis for equanimity. ...
ai-dn33:2.2.36_0: Knowing a thought with the mind, one is preoccupied with a thought that’s a basis for equanimity.
ai-dn33:2.2.38_0: Firstly, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with bodily kindness, both in public and in private.
ai-dn33:2.2.39_0: This warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-dn33:2.2.40_0: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with verbal kindness, both in public and in private.
ai-dn33:2.2.41_0: This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-dn33:2.2.42_0: Furthermore, a mendicant consistently treats their spiritual companions with mental kindness, both in public and in private.
ai-dn33:2.2.43_0: This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-dn33:2.2.44_0: Furthermore, a mendicant shares without reservation any material possessions they have gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with their ethical spiritual companions.
ai-dn33:2.2.45_0: This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-dn33:2.2.46_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives according to the precepts shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. Those precepts are unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.
ai-dn33:2.2.47_0: This too is a warm-hearted quality.
ai-dn33:2.2.48_0: They live according to the view shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private. That view is noble and emancipating, and brings one who practices it to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-dn33:2.2.49_0: This warm-hearted quality makes for fondness and respect, conducing to inclusion, harmony, and unity, without quarreling.
ai-dn33:2.2.51_0: Firstly, a mendicant is irritable and hostile.
ai-dn33:2.2.52_0: Such a mendicant lacks respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and they don’t fulfill the training.
ai-dn33:2.2.53_0: Such a mendicant lacks respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and they don’t fulfill the training.
ai-dn33:2.2.53_1: Disputes are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
ai-dn33:2.2.54_0: If you see such a root of arguments in yourselves or externally,
ai-dn33:2.2.54_1: You should make an effort to give up this bad root of arguments.
ai-dn33:2.2.55_0: If you don’t see it, you shouldn’t see it either.
ai-dn33:2.2.55_1: So you should practice so that bad roots of disputes reappear in the future.
ai-dn33:2.2.56_0: That’s how to give up this bad root of disputes.
ai-dn33:2.2.56_1: In this way that bad root of disputes has no future effect.
ai-dn33:2.2.57_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is offensive and contemptuous ...
ai-dn33:2.2.60_0: They have wicked desires and wrong view ...
ai-dn33:2.2.61_0: They’re attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go.
ai-dn33:2.2.62_0: Any of these is disrespectful and undeferential toward the Teacher, the Teaching, and the Sangha, and he doesn’t fulfill the training.
ai-dn33:2.2.63_0: Such a mendicant lacks respect and reverence for the Teacher, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and they don’t fulfill the training.
ai-dn33:2.2.63_1: Disputes are unbeneficial and a cause of unhappiness for the general population; they are harmful, detrimental, and a cause of suffering for gods and humans.
ai-dn33:2.2.64_0: If you see such a root of arguments in yourselves or externally,
ai-dn33:2.2.64_1: You should make an effort to give up this bad root of arguments.
ai-dn33:2.2.65_0: If you don’t see it, you shouldn’t see it either.
ai-dn33:2.2.65_1: So you should practice so that bad roots of disputes reappear in the future.
ai-dn33:2.2.66_0: That’s how to give up this bad root of disputes.
ai-dn33:2.2.66_1: In this way that bad root of disputes has no future effect.
ai-dn33:2.2.68_0: earth, water, fire, air, space, and consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.2.71_0: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by love. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
ai-dn33:2.2.72_0: Yet somehow ill will still occupies my mind.’
ai-dn33:2.2.73_0: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! ...
ai-dn33:2.2.74_0: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by love has been developed and properly implemented,
ai-dn33:2.2.75_0: yet somehow ill will still occupies the mind.
ai-dn33:2.2.76_0: For it is the heart’s release by love that is the escape from ill will.’
ai-dn33:2.2.78_0: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by compassion. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
ai-dn33:2.2.79_0: Yet somehow negativity still occupies my mind.’
ai-dn33:2.2.80_0: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! ...
ai-dn33:2.2.81_0: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by compassion has been developed and properly implemented,
ai-dn33:2.2.82_0: yet somehow the mind is impossible to occupie it.
ai-dn33:2.2.83_0: For it is the heart’s release by compassion that is the escape from thoughts of harming.’
ai-dn33:2.2.85_0: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by rejoicing. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
ai-dn33:2.2.86_0: Yet somehow negativity still occupies my mind.’
ai-dn33:2.2.87_0: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! ...
ai-dn33:2.2.88_0: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by love has been developed and properly implemented,
ai-dn33:2.2.89_0: yet somehow the mind occupies the mind.
ai-dn33:2.2.90_0: For it is the heart’s release by rejoicing that is the escape from negativity.’
ai-dn33:2.2.92_0: ‘I’ve developed the heart’s release by equanimity. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
ai-dn33:2.2.93_0: Yet somehow negativity still occupies my mind.’
ai-dn33:2.2.94_0: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! ...
ai-dn33:2.2.95_0: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the heart’s release by equanimity has been developed and properly implemented,
ai-dn33:2.2.96_0: yet somehow greed occupies the mind.
ai-dn33:2.2.97_0: For it is the heart’s release by equanimity that is the escape from desire.’
ai-dn33:2.2.99_0: ‘I’ve developed the signless release of the heart. I’ve cultivated it, made it my vehicle and my basis, kept it up, consolidated it, and properly implemented it.
ai-dn33:2.2.100_0: Yet somehow my consciousness still follows after signs.’
ai-dn33:2.2.101_0: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! ...
ai-dn33:2.2.102_0: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the signless release of the heart has been developed and properly implemented,
ai-dn33:2.2.103_0: yet somehow the signs of their consciousness will be attached to.
ai-dn33:2.2.104_0: For it is the signless release of the heart that is the escape from all signs.’
ai-dn33:2.2.106_0: ‘I’m rid of the conceit “I am”. And I don’t regard anything as “I am this”.
ai-dn33:2.2.107_0: Yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies my mind.’
ai-dn33:2.2.108_0: They should be told, ‘Not so, venerable! ...
ai-dn33:2.2.109_0: It’s impossible, reverend, it cannot happen that the conceit “I am” has been done away with, and nothing is regarded as “I am this”,
ai-dn33:2.2.110_0: yet somehow the dart of doubt and indecision still occupies the mind.
ai-dn33:2.2.111_0: For it is the uprooting of the conceit “I am” that is the escape from the dart of doubt and indecision.’
ai-dn33:2.2.113_0: The unsurpassable seeing, listening, acquisition, training, service, and recollection.
ai-dn33:2.2.115_0: the recollection of the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.
ai-dn33:2.2.117_0: A mendicant, seeing a sight with their eyes, is neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-dn33:2.2.118_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-dn33:2.2.119_0: Knowing a thought with the mind, they’re neither happy nor sad, but remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-dn33:2.2.121_0: Someone born into a dark class gives rise to a dark result.
ai-dn33:2.2.122_0: Someone born into a dark class gives rise to a bright result.
ai-dn33:2.2.123_0: Someone born into a dark class gives rise to extinguishment, which is neither dark nor bright.
ai-dn33:2.2.124_0: Someone born into a bright class gives rise to a bright result.
ai-dn33:2.2.125_0: Someone born into a bright class gives rise to a dark result.
ai-dn33:2.2.126_0: Someone born into a bright class gives rise to extinguishment, which is neither dark nor bright.
ai-dn33:2.2.128_0: the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering in impermanence, the perception of not-self in suffering, the perception of giving up, the perception of fading away, and the perception of cessation.
ai-dn33:2.2.129_0: These are the teachings grouped by six that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:2.2.130_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:2.3.1_0: There are teachings grouped by seven that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:2.3.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:2.3.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by seven?
ai-dn33:2.3.5_0: the wealth of faith, ethical conduct, conscience, prudence, learning, generosity, and wisdom.
ai-dn33:2.3.7_0: mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.
ai-dn33:2.3.9_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, and right mindfulness.
ai-dn33:2.3.11_0: a mendicant is faithless, shameless, imprudent, uneducated, lazy, unmindful, and witless.
ai-dn33:2.3.13_0: a mendicant is faithful, conscientious, prudent, learned, energetic, mindful, and wise.
ai-dn33:2.3.14_0: Seven aspects of the teachings of the good persons:
ai-dn33:2.3.15_0: It’s when a mendicant knows the teachings, knows the meaning, has self-knowledge, knows moderation, knows the right time, and knows assemblies.
ai-dn33:2.3.17_0: A mendicant has a keen enthusiasm to undertake the training ...
ai-dn33:2.3.23_0: to penetrate theoretically. And they don’t lose these desires in the future.
ai-dn33:2.3.25_0: the perception of impermanence, the perception of not-self, the perception of ugliness, the perception of drawbacks, the perception of giving up, the perception of fading away, and the perception of cessation.
ai-dn33:2.3.27_0: faith, energy, conscience, prudence, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
ai-dn33:2.3.29_0: There are sentient beings that are diverse in body and diverse in perception, such as human beings, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.
ai-dn33:2.3.30_0: This is the first plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.31_0: There are sentient beings that are diverse in body and unified in perception, such as the gods reborn in Brahmā’s Host through the first absorption.
ai-dn33:2.3.32_0: This is the second plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.33_0: There are sentient beings that are unified in body and diverse in perception, such as the gods of streaming radiance.
ai-dn33:2.3.34_0: This is the third plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.35_0: There are sentient beings that are unified in body and unified in perception, such as the gods replete with glory.
ai-dn33:2.3.36_0: This is the fourth plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.37_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond perceptions of form. With the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-dn33:2.3.38_0: This is the fifth plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.39_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite space. Aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.40_0: This is the sixth plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.41_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness. Aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they have been reborn in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-dn33:2.3.42_0: This is the seventh plane of consciousness.
ai-dn33:2.3.43_0: Seven persons worthy of a religious donation:
ai-dn33:2.3.44_0: One freed both ways, one freed by wisdom, a personal witness, one attained to view, one freed by faith, a follower of the teachings, and a follower by faith.
ai-dn33:2.3.46_0: The underlying tendencies of sensual desire, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-dn33:2.3.48_0: attraction, repulsion, views, doubt, conceit, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.
ai-dn33:2.3.49_0: Seven principles for the settlement of any disciplinary issues that might arise.
ai-dn33:2.3.50_0: Removal in the presence of those concerned is applicable. Removal by accurate recollection is applicable. Removal due to recovery from madness is applicable. The offense should be acknowledged. The decision of a majority. A verdict of aggravated misconduct. Covering over with grass.
ai-dn33:2.3.51_0: These are the teachings grouped by seven that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:2.3.52_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:2.3.53_0: The second recitation section is finished.
ai-dn33:3.1.1_0: There are teachings grouped by eight that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:3.1.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:3.1.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by eight?
ai-dn33:3.1.5_0: wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong immersion.
ai-dn33:3.1.7_0: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
ai-dn33:3.1.8_0: Eight persons worthy of a religious donation.
ai-dn33:3.1.9_0: the stream-enterer, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of stream-entry,
ai-dn33:3.1.9_1: the once-returner, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of once-returning,
ai-dn33:3.1.9_2: the non-returner, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of non-returning,
ai-dn33:3.1.9_3: the Worthy One, and he who is practising for the direct realisation of the fruit of Worthiness.
ai-dn33:3.1.11_0: Firstly, a mendicant has some work to do.
ai-dn33:3.1.13_0: ‘I have some work to do. But while doing it my body will get tired. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.14_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-dn33:3.1.15_0: This is the first ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.16_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has done some work.
ai-dn33:3.1.18_0: ‘I’ve done some work. But while working my body got tired. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.19_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy...
ai-dn33:3.1.20_0: This is the second ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.21_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has to go on a journey.
ai-dn33:3.1.23_0: ‘I have to go on a journey. But while walking my body will get tired. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.24_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy...
ai-dn33:3.1.25_0: This is the third ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.26_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has gone on a journey.
ai-dn33:3.1.28_0: ‘I’ve gone on a journey. But while walking my body got tired. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.29_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy...
ai-dn33:3.1.30_0: This is the fourth ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.31_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has wandered for alms, but they didn’t get to fill up on as much food as they like, rough or fine.
ai-dn33:3.1.33_0: ‘I’ve wandered for alms, but I didn’t get to fill up on as much food as I like, rough or fine. My body is tired and unfit for work. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.34_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy...
ai-dn33:3.1.35_0: This is the fifth ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.36_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has wandered for alms, and they got to fill up on as much food as they like, rough or fine.
ai-dn33:3.1.38_0: ‘I’ve wandered for alms, and I got to fill up on as much food as I like, rough or fine. My body is heavy and unfit for work, like I’ve just eaten a load of beans. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.39_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy...
ai-dn33:3.1.40_0: This is the sixth ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.41_0: Furthermore, a mendicant feels a little sick.
ai-dn33:3.1.43_0: ‘I feel a little sick. Lying down would be good for me. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.44_0: I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.45_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy...
ai-dn33:3.1.46_0: This is the seventh ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.47_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has recently recovered from illness.
ai-dn33:3.1.49_0: ‘I’ve recently recovered from illness. My body is weak and unfit for work. I’d better have a lie down.’
ai-dn33:3.1.50_0: They lie down, and don’t rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-dn33:3.1.51_0: This is the eighth ground for laziness.
ai-dn33:3.1.53_0: Firstly, a mendicant has some work to do.
ai-dn33:3.1.55_0: ‘I have some work to do. While working it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-dn33:3.1.56_0: They rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-dn33:3.1.57_0: This is the first ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.58_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has done some work.
ai-dn33:3.1.60_0: ‘I’ve done some work. While I was working I wasn’t able to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.62_0: This is the second ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.63_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has to go on a journey.
ai-dn33:3.1.65_0: ‘I have to go on a journey. While walking it’s not easy to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.66_0: I’d better preemptively rouse up energy ...’ ...
ai-dn33:3.1.68_0: This is the third ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.69_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has gone on a journey.
ai-dn33:3.1.71_0: ‘I’ve gone on a journey. While I was walking I wasn’t able to focus on the instructions of the Buddhas. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.73_0: This is the fourth ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.74_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has wandered for alms, but they didn’t get to fill up on as much food as they like, rough or fine.
ai-dn33:3.1.76_0: ‘I’ve wandered for alms, but I didn’t get to fill up on as much food as I like, rough or fine. My body is strong and fit for work. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.78_0: This is the fifth ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.79_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has wandered for alms, and they got to fill up on as much food as they like, rough or fine.
ai-dn33:3.1.81_0: ‘I’ve wandered for alms, and I got to fill up on as much food as I like, rough or fine. My body is strong and fit for work. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.83_0: This is the sixth ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.84_0: Furthermore, a mendicant feels a little sick.
ai-dn33:3.1.86_0: ‘I feel a little sick. It’s possible this illness will worsen. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.88_0: This is the seventh ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.89_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has recently recovered from illness.
ai-dn33:3.1.91_0: ‘I’ve recently recovered from illness. It’s possible the illness will come back. I’d better preemptively rouse up energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.’
ai-dn33:3.1.92_0: They rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized.
ai-dn33:3.1.93_0: This is the eighth ground for arousing energy.
ai-dn33:3.1.95_0: A person might give a gift after insulting the recipient. Or they give out of fear. Or they give thinking, ‘They gave to me.’ Or they give thinking, ‘They’ll give to me.’ Or they give thinking, ‘It’s good to give.’ Or they give thinking, ‘I cook, they don’t. It wouldn’t be right for me to not give to them.’ Or they give thinking, ‘By giving this gift I’ll get a good reputation.’ Or they give thinking, ‘This is an adornment and requisite for the mind.’
ai-dn33:3.1.96_0: Or they give thinking, ‘This is an adornment and requisite for the mind.’
ai-dn33:3.1.98_0: First, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins such things as food, drink, clothing, vehicles; garlands, fragrance, and makeup; and bed, house, and lighting.
ai-dn33:3.1.99_0: Whatever they give, they expect something back.
ai-dn33:3.1.100_0: They see an affluent aristocrat or brahmin or householder amusing themselves, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-dn33:3.1.102_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of well-to-do aristocrats or brahmins or householders.’
ai-dn33:3.1.103_0: They settle on that thought, concentrate on it and develop it. As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
ai-dn33:3.1.104_0: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
ai-dn33:3.1.105_0: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.
ai-dn33:3.1.106_0: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins.
ai-dn33:3.1.107_0: Whatever they give, they expect something back.
ai-dn33:3.1.109_0: ‘The Gods of the Four Great Kings are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.111_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods of the Four Great Kings!’
ai-dn33:3.1.112_0: They settle on that thought, concentrate on it and develop it. As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
ai-dn33:3.1.113_0: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
ai-dn33:3.1.114_0: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.
ai-dn33:3.1.115_0: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins.
ai-dn33:3.1.116_0: Whatever they give, they expect something back.
ai-dn33:3.1.121_0: the gods who delight in creation ...
ai-dn33:3.1.122_0: the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.124_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others!’
ai-dn33:3.1.125_0: They settle on that thought, concentrate on it and develop it. As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
ai-dn33:3.1.126_0: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
ai-dn33:3.1.127_0: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their purity.
ai-dn33:3.1.128_0: Next, someone gives to ascetics or brahmins ...
ai-dn33:3.1.129_0: Whatever they give, they expect something back.
ai-dn33:3.1.131_0: ‘The Gods of Brahmā’s Host are long-lived, beautiful, and very happy.’
ai-dn33:3.1.133_0: ‘If only, when my body breaks up, after death, I would be reborn in the company of the Gods of Brahmā’s Host!’
ai-dn33:3.1.134_0: They settle on that thought, concentrate on it and develop it. As they’ve settled for less and not developed further, their thought leads to rebirth there.
ai-dn33:3.1.135_0: But I say that this is only for those of ethical conduct, not for the unethical.
ai-dn33:3.1.136_0: And for those free of desire, not those with desire.
ai-dn33:3.1.137_0: The heart’s wish of an ethical person succeeds because of their freedom from desire.
ai-dn33:3.1.139_0: the assemblies of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and ascetics. An assembly of the gods under the Four Great Kings. An assembly of the gods under the Thirty-Three. An assembly of Māras. An assembly of Brahmās.
ai-dn33:3.1.141_0: gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.
ai-dn33:3.1.143_0: Perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.144_0: This is the first dimension of mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.145_0: Perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.147_0: This is the second means of (mind) mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.148_0: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.149_0: This is the third dimension of mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.150_0: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly. Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.151_0: This is the fourth dimension of mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.152_0: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.153_0: They’re like a flax flower that’s blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.154_0: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.155_0: This is the fifth means of (mind) mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.156_0: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.157_0: They’re like a champak flower that’s yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.158_0: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.159_0: This is the sixth dimension of mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.160_0: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are red, with red color, red hue, and red tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.161_0: They’re like a scarlet mallow flower that’s red, with red color, red hue, and red tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, red, with red color, red hue, and red tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.162_0: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.163_0: This is the seventh means of (mind) mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.164_0: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.165_0: They’re like the morning star that’s white, with white color, white hue, and white tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.
ai-dn33:3.1.166_0: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’
ai-dn33:3.1.167_0: This is the eighth dimension of mastery.
ai-dn33:3.1.171_0: Not perceiving forms internally, he sees forms externally.
ai-dn33:3.1.175_0: Going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-dn33:3.1.177_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-dn33:3.1.179_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-dn33:3.1.181_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-dn33:3.1.183_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-dn33:3.1.185_0: These are the teachings grouped by eight that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:3.1.186_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:3.2.1_0: There are teachings grouped by nine that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:3.2.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:3.2.5_0: Thinking: ‘They did wrong to me,’ you harbor resentment.
ai-dn33:3.2.6_0: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong to me’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.8_0: ‘They did wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.9_0: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.10_0: ‘They will do wrong by someone I love’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.13_0: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike,’ you harbor resentment.
ai-dn33:3.2.14_0: Nine methods to get rid of resentment.
ai-dn33:3.2.15_0: Thinking: ‘They did wrong to me, but what can I possibly do?’ you get rid of resentment.
ai-dn33:3.2.16_0: Thinking: ‘They are doing wrong to me ...’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.18_0: ‘They did wrong by someone I love ...’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.19_0: ‘They are doing wrong by someone I love ...’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.20_0: Thinking: ‘They will harm someone I love ...’ ...
ai-dn33:3.2.23_0: Thinking: ‘They will help someone I dislike, but what can I possibly do?’ you get rid of resentment.
ai-dn33:3.2.25_0: There are sentient beings that are diverse in body and diverse in perception, such as human beings, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.
ai-dn33:3.2.26_0: This is the first abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.27_0: There are sentient beings that are diverse in body and unified in perception, such as the gods reborn in Brahmā’s Host through the first absorption.
ai-dn33:3.2.28_0: This is the second abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.29_0: There are sentient beings that are unified in body and diverse in perception, such as the gods of streaming radiance.
ai-dn33:3.2.30_0: This is the third abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.31_0: There are sentient beings that are unified in body and unified in perception, such as the gods replete with glory.
ai-dn33:3.2.32_0: This is the fourth abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.33_0: There are sentient beings that are non-percipient and do not experience anything, such as the gods who are non-percipient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.34_0: This is the fifth abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.35_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond perceptions of form. With the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-dn33:3.2.36_0: This is the sixth abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.37_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite space. Aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-dn33:3.2.38_0: This is the seventh abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.39_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness. Aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they have been reborn in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-dn33:3.2.40_0: This is the eighth abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.41_0: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of nothingness. They have been reborn in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-dn33:3.2.42_0: This is the ninth abode of sentient beings.
ai-dn33:3.2.43_0: Nine lost opportunities for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.44_0: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world. He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.
ai-dn33:3.2.45_0: But this person has been reborn in hell.
ai-dn33:3.2.46_0: This is the first lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.47_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.48_0: But a person has been reborn in the animal realm.
ai-dn33:3.2.49_0: This is the second lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.50_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.51_0: has been reborn in the ghost realm.
ai-dn33:3.2.52_0: This is the third lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.53_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.54_0: But a person has been reborn among the demons.
ai-dn33:3.2.55_0: This is the fourth lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.56_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.57_0: But a person has been reborn in one of the long-lived orders of gods.
ai-dn33:3.2.58_0: This is the fifth lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.59_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.60_0: But a person has been reborn in the borderlands, among strange barbarian tribes, where monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen do not go.
ai-dn33:3.2.61_0: This is the sixth lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.62_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.63_0: And a person is reborn in a central country. But they have wrong view and distorted perspective:
ai-dn33:3.2.64_0: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings. There’s no fruit or result of good and bad deeds. There’s no afterlife. There are no duties to mother and father. No beings are reborn spontaneously. And there’s no ascetic or brahmin who is well attained and practiced, and who describes the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.’
ai-dn33:3.2.65_0: This is the seventh lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.66_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.67_0: And a person is reborn in a central country.
ai-dn33:3.2.67_1: But they’re witless, dull, stupid, and unable to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.
ai-dn33:3.2.68_0: This is the eighth lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.69_0: Furthermore, a Realized One has arisen in the world.
ai-dn33:3.2.70_0: So he doesn’t teach the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.
ai-dn33:3.2.70_1: And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.
ai-dn33:3.2.71_0: This is the ninth lost opportunity for spiritual practice.
ai-dn33:3.2.73_0: A mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-dn33:3.2.75_0: And with the fading away of rapture, they enter and remain in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
ai-dn33:3.2.77_0: Going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space.
ai-dn33:3.2.78_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness.
ai-dn33:3.2.79_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-dn33:3.2.80_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.
ai-dn33:3.2.81_0: Going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling.
ai-dn33:3.2.83_0: For someone who has attained the first absorption, sensual perceptions have ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.84_0: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.85_0: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.86_0: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.87_0: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.88_0: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.89_0: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.90_0: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.91_0: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.
ai-dn33:3.2.92_0: These are the teachings grouped by nine that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:3.2.93_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:3.3.1_0: There are teachings grouped by ten that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:3.3.2_0: You should all recite these in concert.
ai-dn33:3.3.3_0: What are the teachings grouped by ten?
ai-dn33:3.3.4_0: Ten qualities that serve as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.5_1: Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-dn33:3.3.6_0: A mendicant is ethical, restrained in the monastic code, conducting themselves well and seeking alms in suitable places. Seeing danger in the slightest fault, they keep the rules they’ve undertaken.
ai-dn33:3.3.7_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.8_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is very learned, remembering and keeping what they’ve learned.
ai-dn33:3.3.10_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.11_0: Furthermore, a mendicant has good friends, companions, and associates.
ai-dn33:3.3.12_0: That mendicant has good friends, companions, and associates.
ai-dn33:3.3.13_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.14_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is easy to admonish, having qualities that make them easy to admonish. They’re patient, and take instruction respectfully.
ai-dn33:3.3.16_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.17_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is deft and tireless in a diverse spectrum of duties for their spiritual companions, understanding how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work.
ai-dn33:3.3.18_0: This mendicant is worth listening to.
ai-dn33:3.3.19_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.20_0: Furthermore, a mendicant loves the teachings and is a delight to converse with, being full of joy in the teaching and training.
ai-dn33:3.3.21_0: Any mendicant who wants to listen to the teaching ...
ai-dn33:3.3.22_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.23_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is content with any kind of robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
ai-dn33:3.3.25_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.26_0: Furthermore, a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They are strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
ai-dn33:3.3.27_0: An energetic mendicant lives with energy roused up ...
ai-dn33:3.3.28_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.29_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
ai-dn33:3.3.31_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.32_0: Furthermore, a mendicant is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
ai-dn33:3.3.34_0: This is a quality that serves as protector.
ai-dn33:3.3.36_0: Someone perceives the meditation on universal earth above, below, across, non-dual and limitless.
ai-dn33:3.3.37_0: They perceive the meditation on universal water ...
ai-dn33:3.3.45_0: They perceive the meditation on universal consciousness above, below, across, non-dual and limitless.
ai-dn33:3.3.46_0: Ten ways of doing unskillful deeds:
ai-dn33:3.3.47_0: killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct.
ai-dn33:3.3.48_0: Ten ways of doing skillful deeds:
ai-dn33:3.3.49_0: refraining from killing living creatures, stealing, and sexual misconduct; avoiding speech that’s false, divisive, harsh, or nonsensical; contentment, good will, and right view.
ai-dn33:3.3.51_0: A mendicant has given up five factors, possesses six factors, has a single guard, has four supports, has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth, has totally given up searching, has unsullied intentions, has stilled the physical process, and is well freed in mind and well freed by wisdom.
ai-dn33:3.3.52_0: And how has a mendicant given up five factors?
ai-dn33:3.3.53_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
ai-dn33:3.3.54_0: That’s how a mendicant has given up five factors.
ai-dn33:3.3.55_0: And how does a mendicant possess six factors?
ai-dn33:3.3.56_0: A mendicant, seeing a sight with their eyes, is neither happy nor sad. They remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-dn33:3.3.57_0: When you hear a sound with your ears ...
ai-dn33:3.3.58_0: Knowing a thought with the mind, they’re neither happy nor sad, but remain equanimous, mindful and aware.
ai-dn33:3.3.59_0: That’s how a mendicant possesses six factors.
ai-dn33:3.3.60_0: And how does a mendicant have a single guard?
ai-dn33:3.3.61_0: It’s when a mendicant’s heart is guarded by mindfulness.
ai-dn33:3.3.62_0: That’s how a mendicant has a single guard.
ai-dn33:3.3.63_0: And how does a mendicant have four supports?
ai-dn33:3.3.64_0: After appraisal, a mendicant uses some things, endures some things, avoids some things, and gets rid of some things.
ai-dn33:3.3.65_0: That’s how a mendicant has four supports.
ai-dn33:3.3.66_0: And how has a mendicant eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth?
ai-dn33:3.3.67_0: Different ascetics and brahmins have different idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth. A mendicant has dispelled, eliminated, thrown out, rejected, let go of, given up, and relinquished all these.
ai-dn33:3.3.68_0: That’s how a mendicant has eliminated idiosyncratic interpretations of the truth.
ai-dn33:3.3.69_0: And how has a mendicant totally given up searching?
ai-dn33:3.3.70_0: It’s when they’ve given up searching for sensual pleasures, for continued existence, and for a spiritual path.
ai-dn33:3.3.71_0: That’s how a mendicant has totally given up searching.
ai-dn33:3.3.72_0: And how does a mendicant have unsullied intentions?
ai-dn33:3.3.73_0: It’s when they’ve given up sensual, malicious, and cruel intentions.
ai-dn33:3.3.74_0: That’s how a mendicant has unsullied intentions.
ai-dn33:3.3.75_0: And how has a mendicant stilled the physical process?
ai-dn33:3.3.76_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-dn33:3.3.77_0: That’s how a mendicant has stilled the physical process.
ai-dn33:3.3.78_0: And how is a mendicant well freed in mind?
ai-dn33:3.3.79_0: It’s when a mendicant’s mind is freed from greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-dn33:3.3.80_0: That’s how a mendicant is well freed in mind.
ai-dn33:3.3.81_0: And how is a mendicant well freed by wisdom?
ai-dn33:3.3.82_0: It’s when a mendicant understands: ‘I’ve given up greed, hate, and delusion, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.’
ai-dn33:3.3.83_0: They understand: ‘I’ve given up hate, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.’
ai-dn33:3.3.85_0: That’s how a mendicant’s mind is well freed by wisdom.
ai-dn33:3.3.87_0: an adept’s right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, right immersion, right knowledge, and right freedom.
ai-dn33:3.3.88_0: Reverends, these are the teachings grouped by ten that have been rightly explained by the Buddha.
ai-dn33:3.3.89_0: You should all recite these in concert, without disputing, so that this spiritual path may last for a long time. That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”
ai-dn33:3.4.1_0: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-dn33:3.4.3_0: It’s good that you’ve taught this exposition of the reciting in concert.”
ai-dn33:3.4.4_0: That is what Venerable Sāriputta said, and the teacher approved.
ai-dn33:3.4.5_0: and those monks were uplifted and greatly rejoiced in venerable Sāriputta’s words.
ai-dn33:3.4.6_0: The tenth section on the recitation passage is finished.
